description:
Title: SÅ‚uÅ¼by Specialne (Secret Wars, also known as Secret Services)
Genres: political thriller, crime, drama, political (non-)fiction,
Production: Poland / year: 2014 / type: Movie
Language: Polish / +English subtitles (SRT)

World-class marks director Patryk Vega was return to Polish cinemas after having obtained wide-spread celebrity status in his home country thanks to the TV Series "Pitbull" (2005-2007). After two more subdued films (Ciacho and Last Minute), the filmmaker is re-emerging on the scene with a confrontational feature that is already garnering him a lot of attention: Secret Wars (SÅ‚uÅ¼by Specjalne).
A movie opening scenes of life and work of officers of the Polish Secret Services. When in 2006 were eliminated inforamtsionnye Polsh Military Intelligence Service (WSI), politicians realized that the country was deprived of eyes and ears. A new secret intelligence agency, designed a variety of methods to protect the peace of citizens.
In this political thriller, the director presents his own interpretation of contemporary Polish history. Vega invades the private and day-to-day lives of three army officers in order to decipher the minds and mental functioning of Secret Agents working in the most dangerous areas: the world of crime and the rogue sides of politics, business and the media.
"My films are realist documents of mankindâ€™s most sombre side" the director emphasised. And indeed, his film is not a work of fiction: "In principle, not a single scene has been invented, and the dialogue has all been drawn directly from real life"
It is an uncompromising exploration that undoubtedly makes it one of Polish cinemaâ€™s most remarkable socio-political works of the last few years.

TRAILER

The film stars: Olga Boladz, Andrzej Grabowski, Agata Kulesza, Eryk Lubos, Wojciech Zielinski, Janusz Chabior, Kamilla Baar, Jan Frycz and Wojciech Machnicki. 
Produced by Ent One, "Secret Wars" has been co-produced by Add Sum, Aeroplan and Octocam Servimedia. Shot in Iraq, Poland, Italy and Lithuania by director of photography Miroslaw Brozek.
